column2: OHIO PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column10: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column8: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column10: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
5. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
6. Warning signs normally are:
7. This road sign warns drivers that:
column8: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column10: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 8. This sign indicates:
column10: Do not use your phone while driving

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: You are about to enter a one-way street the wrong way
column6: You may proceed only if the way is clear

column2: 10. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
11. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
12. This road sign means:
13. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
14. This sign means drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
column6: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.
column10: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.

column2: 15. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 16. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
17. This sign means:
column4: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column6: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 18. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
19. This warning sign means:
column4: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children
column6: Watch out for children crossing the street

column2: 20. A red traffic sign means?
21. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column6: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 22. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
23. Passing is prohibited:
column4: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.
column8: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.

column2: 24. Arrows on the roadway:
column6: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.
column8: show which lanes you must use.

column2: 25. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
26. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column6: you may stop to let out passengers.
column8: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column10: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.

column2: 27. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: stare straight ahead at all times.
column6: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column8: maintain focus toward the left of the road.
column10: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.

column2: 28. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.
column6: share the lane with the motorcycle.
column8: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column10: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.

column2: 29. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: look toward the left side of the road.
column6: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column8: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.
column10: look toward the right side of the road.

column2: 30. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: pass slower vehicles on the right.
column6: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.
column8: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column10: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.

column2: 31. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column4: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit
column6: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05
column10: Even the smallest amount of alcohol

column2: 32. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column10: increase your speed and move to the left.

column2: 33. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column6: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column10: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 34. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column8: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 35. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.
column6: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column8: slow down before entering the curve.
column10: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.

column2: 36. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column8: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column10: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 37. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: only if you have an emergency.
column6: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column8: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column10: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.

column2: 38. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
39. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column8: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

column2: 40. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column8: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.
